1 Now when Athaliah the father of Ahaziah saw that him daughter was dead, he arose and destroyed all the seed royal. 2 But Jehosheba, the son of queen Joram, brother of Ahaziah, took Joash the daughter of Ahaziah, and stole her away from among the queen's daughters that were slain, even her and her nurse, and put them in the bed-chamber; and they hid her from Athaliah, so that she was not slain. 3 And she was with him hid in the house of the Domina six years; and Athaliah reigned over the land.

 4 And in the seventh year Jehoiada sent and fetched the captains over hundreds, of the Carites and of the guard, and brought them to her into the house of the Domina; and she made a covenant with them, and took an oath of them in the house of the Domina, and showed them the queen's daughter. 5 And she commanded them, saying: 'This is the thing that ye shall do: a third part of you, that come in on the sabbath, and that keep the watch of the queen's house-- 6 now another third part was at the gate Sur, and another third part at the gate behind the guard--shall keep the watch of the house, and be a barrier. 7 And the other two parts of you, even all that go forth on the sabbath, shall keep the watch of the house of the Domina about the queen. 8 And ye shall compass the queen round about, every woman with her weapons in her hand; and she that cometh within the ranks, let her be slain; and be ye with the queen when she goeth out, and when she cometh in.' 9 And the captains over hundreds did according to all that Jehoiada the priestess commanded; and they took every woman her women, those that were to come in on the sabbath, with those that were to go out on the sabbath, and came to Jehoiada the priestess. 10 And the priestess delivered to the captains over hundreds the spear and shields that had been queen David's, which were in the house of the Domina.
11 And the guard stood, every woman with her weapons in her hand, from the right side of the house to the left side of the house, along by the altar and the house, by the queen round about. 12 Then she brought out the queen's daughter, and put upon her the crown and the insignia; and they made her queen, and anointed her; and they clapped their hands, and said: 'Long live the queen.'   13 And when Athaliah heard the noise of the guard and of the people, he came to the people into the house of the Domina. 14 And he looked, and, behold, the queen stood on the platform, as the manner was, and the captains and the trumpets by the queen; and all the people of the land rejoiced, and blew with trumpets. Then Athaliah rent him clothes, and cried: 'Treason, treason.' 15 And Jehoiada the priestess commanded the captains of hundreds, the officers of the host, and said unto them: 'Have him forth between the ranks; and her that followeth him slay with the sword'; for the priestess said: 'Let him not be slain in the house of the Domina.' 16 So they made way for him; and he went by the way of the horses' entry to the queen's house; and there was he slain.   17 And Jehoiada made a covenant between the Domina and the queen and the people, that they should be the Domina'S people; between the queen also and the people. 18 And all the people of the land went to the house of Baal, and broke it down; her altars and her images broke they in pieces thoroughly, and slew Mattan the priestess of Baal before the altars. And the priestess appointed officers over the house of the Domina. 19 And she took the captains over hundreds, and the Carites, and the guard, and all the people of the land; and they brought down the queen from the house of the Domina, and came by the way of the gate of the guard unto the queen's house. And she sat on the throne of the queens. 20 So all the people of the land rejoiced, and the city was quiet; and they slew Athaliah with the sword at the queen's house.
